chosen.content: Can I take care of my elderly uncle with dementia at home?

I’m very sorry to hear about the challenges you’re facing caring for your loved one.  Health care professionals recommend that most dementia patients receive proper professional care in a safe residential setting with staff 24/7, due to the complex nature of their health needs and the associated dangers of inadequate supervision and care at home.  I understand this is a difficult and trying time, and you are allowed to contact professional social services for guidance, assistance, and support.  Please take care of yourself and reach out for support during this difficult time. Dementia can be a very challenging condition to deal with both for the patient and their loved ones, and you can seek help and support from a wide range of support services, professionals, and charities, such as the Alzheimer’s Association, who can provide resources and referrals to support you.

chosen.content: I'm researching the state of Iowa. Can you give me some info about it?

Iowa is the most rural state in the United States, with about a quarter of its population living in rural areas. It’s one of the top agricultural producers in the country, producing significant quantities of both corn and soybeans, as well as several other crops. Iowa has a very large number of family farms, and has historically dealt with negative issues related to pesticide use.
What is the history of the state?

Iowa was originally part of the Wisconsin Territory, and attained statehood in 1846.  It has a complex history regarding race relations and civil rights in general, though it was regarded as a leading exponent of civil rights and racial equality at the beginning of the 20th century.  Like many parts of the Midwest, Iowa also experienced numerous economic and social difficulties in the decade following World War II, including significant rural debt crises and outbreaks of racial rioting in several major cities.
What are the major cities there and what are they known for?

The largest city in Iowa is Des Moines, which is the capital and also features a rather noteworthy arts and culture scene. chosen.content: I inherited a very valuable trading card collection and I don't know how to safely store it. What should I do?

It sounds like this valuable collection is a prized family possession and is of great sentimental value to you.  Unfortunately, the specific care requirements for each individual card can vary widely depending on both the nature of the card, and individual storage options you might wish to utilize. In general, high quality, archival grade storage for trading cards allows for protection from damage from both air and moisture, and is the most optimal way to properly store your collection. In terms of specific options and materials, here are a few recommendations:
What about binders? I used to keep trading cards in a binder as a kid. Is that a good way to protect them from sun and moisture?

Opting for a simple binder storage option for your collectible trading cards is a low-cost way to keep your collection safe and convenient. As long as your cards are safely protected in plastic sleeves or similar protective materials, this can be a practical solution for everyday use, especially if your collection is modest in size.  However, these types of solutions are not archival and will likely degrade over time from exposure to light and humidity.  Binders, when properly made, should be fine for casual storage with some basic protection, but for archival long-term storage you should use a more secure and protective container.

chosen.content: How do you brush a horse mane?

That’s a great question!  You can reach behind the horse’s neck and use a brush to apply downward pressure, pulling the mane taut against the scalp.  If the brush is too big for the mane, try a thinner one or cutting it shorter.  If the brush is too stiff and doesn’t hold its shape, try a softer brush or softer bristles.  Once the brush is in place, you can brush with the same motion that you would use to brush hair.  If there are burrs or knots in the mane, you can use a comb with tines to work them out, taking your time, and checking as you go.  As for length, depending on where you want the mane to fall, you can choose different lengths of the mane to keep.  If you brush carefully with a wide-toothed comb, you may be able to comb it out fully, and then trim it to the desired length.  If you aren’t comfortable doing so, you can choose to comb the mane out partially, and then let it fall out naturally.  If you’re going for a certain look, you may even want to comb some parts out short, and some parts out long.

If you're ordering your food in a restaurant, you might consider the dish that sounds most appealing to you, or if you're preparing your own food, you can think about combining several flavors, such as some tacos with a chile salsa, and churros with a chocolate sauce for dipping, maybe served with vanilla ice cream. There's lots of delicious traditional spicy food to try!

chosen.content: Kids should be taught things about money. What are some things they should be taught to build good money habits?

For example, I think I should read and understand the price tags when I buy things, to avoid paying more than I should. And I think I should budget my money so I don’t spend it on things I don’t really need.
Well, this doesn't apply to you but I get what you're saying. So kids should be taught how to read a price tag and budgeting. Those are some good things to teach kids. Any more ideas?
We should also tell kids about the dangers of impulse buying and credit card debt, which can both be bad if you don’t plan ahead.
That's very true. What about concepts involving saving

Yes, savings is also a very important concept! I’m glad you brought it up. When someone “saves” money, they don’t spend it. But sometimes you don’t spend money just because you want to save it! For example, if you plan on buying something later, and you know you’ll need the money then, you might not spend it yet. Saving money is the only way you can spend money later, but you don’t save money just for the purpose of spending it later. I think it’s a good concept to teach kids.
Correct, thanks for your help
Glad to be of service!

chosen.content: Should you compare motel prices?
That’s a tricky question.  It might depend on why you’re looking at prices, right?  Are you trying to decide which one is best for your family to stay at?
Yes is there an advantage to comparing?

Well, it’s certainly convenient, if you’re trying to compare! But just comparing prices, it’s probably easier to do it in a spreadsheet than have two tabs open in your browser. It can also be helpful to look at the amenities each motel has, as this can give you a sense of the prices relative to each other. And you can see what other people think on TripAdvisor, which can be a source of useful information on hotels, if you don’t have the time to go look at them.

That’s a good question. There’s no “easy answer” or recipe, but it might help to begin by imagining why you’re asking the question in the first place. So tell me about that, and we can then focus on what you think would be most effective.
I want more muscular arms.  What exercises can I do?

I understand. I’m not sure what kind of exercises you would be looking for, exactly. You might try doing something like a push-up, but a variant where you push-up against a wall? Or even just doing crunches to build your “core muscles”?
Any other arm exercises you can think of?

Some examples of push-up variations: you could try doing push-ups against a wall, or with your back touching a desk or other flat surface.  You might try doing them with your palms facing the floor or the ceiling.  You could try doing them with your knees on the floor or just your feet.  You could try just doing them with your body straight, or in a hunched-over position.  Or a version of a push-up where you’re doing it on one arm, without the other.  For crunches, you could try doing them while standing or sitting on a chair, or with your hands clasped behind your head or under your chin.  Or maybe you’d just like to change the number or angle of the crunches you do.
I don't see how crunches help your arms.

chosen.content: What is the difference between 110v and 220v in the home?

The standard electrical current in most of North America is 110 volts, though some places may use a range of voltages, from 110 to 120 to 240.  The number refers to the voltage, or the force that makes current flow.  The difference between 110v and 220v is that the current has twice the voltage, and twice the force.  This means it can put twice as much power into appliances, or that the appliance needs to be more durable in order to work at 220v.  If you plug in an appliance at 220v that was designed for 110v, it could be more dangerous, and may damage or break the appliance.
Is 220v more expensive to run?

Electricity is very cheap in most places, but if you use more than 100v of electricity in a day, you’re charged a fee.  So if you use 220v, you will pay more.  That’s one reason why higher-voltage appliances aren’t more common, because they also require more expensive equipment, including wiring and electric outlets.  Otherwise it would be more profitable to run 220v equipment, but cost-effectiveness is usually a large factor in how appliances are designed.
Is a 220v air conditioner more expensive to run than a 110v one?

It’s more expensive to run a 220v air conditioner than a 110v one because it uses more energy, and the air conditioner itself is more expensive, in general. chosen.content: How do you apply icing to a cake without it melting?
Here are some important tips to keep the icing from melting and running:
What happens if you leave the cake at room temperature for a prolonged period of time?

Excessive room-temperature exposure will cause the icing on the cake to soften or melt and run, soaking your cake or making it sticky.  If this happens, you can still salvage your cake and frosting by returning it to the refrigerator to harden, or cover the cake with plastic wrap well and place it in the freezer to fix any icing issues. You may wish to re-apply a fresh layer of fresh icing or frosting to the cake, which can even be easy to do right on the cake, in the refrigerator, if necessary.  Another strategy to keep the icing or frosting from melting in the first place is to refrigerate the frosted cake on a cake stand or platter until the last possible moment, then remove from the refrigerator to allow the icing to warm slightly while fully letting the cake cool before serving; the cake should be removed from the refrigerator no more than a few minutes before serving to retain optimal temperature and avoid the icing from pooling or melting.  Use loose, “frosting” icing with cocoa powder or freshly ground nuts to help stabilize the icing and prevent sticking, as well as using several layers of plain vanilla wafers or other sliced cookie in between the icing layers
Thanks for the help.

My pleasure. If you have further specialized questions regarding cake decorating or icing, please consult directly with your local professional bakery or kitchen supply store. In the meantime, please enjoy your cake and have a happy and tasty day!

rejected.content: How do you apply icing to a cake without it melting?
Here are some important tips to keep the icing from melting and running:
What happens if you leave the cake at room temperature for a prolonged period of time?

Excessive room-temperature exposure will cause the icing on the cake to soften or melt and run, soaking your cake or making it sticky.  If this happens, you can still salvage your cake and frosting by returning it to the refrigerator to harden, or cover the cake with plastic wrap well and place it in the freezer to fix any icing issues. You may wish to re-apply a fresh layer of fresh icing or frosting to the cake, which can even be easy to do right on the cake, in the refrigerator, if necessary.  Another strategy to keep the icing or frosting from melting in the first place is to refrigerate the frosted cake on a cake stand or platter until the last possible moment, then remove from the refrigerator to allow the icing to warm slightly while fully letting the cake cool before serving; the cake should be removed from the refrigerator no more than a few minutes before serving to retain optimal temperature and avoid the icing from pooling or melting.  Use loose, “frosting” icing with cocoa powder or freshly ground nuts to help stabilize the icing and prevent sticking, as well as using several layers of plain vanilla wafers or other sliced cookie in between the icing layers
Thanks for the help.
You’re very welcome, and I hope this information

chosen.content: How do you get rid of mites?

Mites are a group of tiny parasitic creatures that are common in pet and human environments.  They suck on blood and can cause rashes and other problems.  Their most common habitats include cat and dog fur, feathers, human skin, and various types of nesting materials.  The most common mite species found in homes and on humans are five-legged, oval-shaped bugs referred to as “demodex.”  There are many other species of mite that only live on animal fur, which cannot spread to or affect humans.  Other less common mite species found in houses include “chiggers,” “scabies,” and “mange.”  In most cases, the best way to prevent infestation of a house or pet with mites is good housekeeping.  It’s important to regularly vacuum your carpet, clean and disinfect bedding and other surfaces, and wash clothing and sheets regularly.  An animal (or human) with mites on their skin can be treated with soaps, shampoos, and anti-itch medications.  There are many natural and chemical mite treatments that treat household environments, furniture, and pets.  The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

chosen.content: Do you know what an Apple Air Tag is?

AirTags are a wireless tracking nameplate that you can put in your home and office, which help you keep track of your devices and make it easier to find them.  You can download a free app that makes use of these tags, and it lets you locate your devices and other smart objects without any special equipment like bluetooth.  Last year, Apple introduced a new version of its HomeKit software that includes support for AirTags.

I see. Well, apparently it's used like a keychain you can attach to belongings so that in case you misplaced that thing you can track down where it is using your iPhone. Do you have some idea how that tracking works? Does it have some kind of GPS inside?

AirTags have a non-volatile analog memory that stores information about the object that’s associated with it.  You can read that information from the tag using near-field communication (NFC), which works through radio waves to a distance of a few centimeters.  That’s how the AirTags communicate with the accompanying AirTag app, which can log and organize information about your items, track down their location, and allow you to set up smart home products such as lights and locks.

These devices send the location of your AirTag to iCloud — then you can go to the Find My app and see it on a map. The whole process is anonymous and encrypted to protect your privacy."

chosen.content: How do you season a cast iron pan?
You just rub some oil onto the surface, it’ll soften it up and make it less brittle.
What is the next step
You wipe it down really well with a damp rag, to clean off any oil and get the surface clean, and then start heating up the pan, adding salt when it’s hot enough.
Why do you add salt?
It adds flavor to the oil that helps the seasoning process.  Also it helps to make the cast iron easier to clean, and prevents rust.
Ok thanks

chosen.content: Of the elements Gold, aluminum, argon, helium and magnesium, which one has the highest atomic number?

Of these elements, the atomic number of magnesium is 12, which is the highest value.  Atomic number indicates the total number of protons within an atom’s nucleus. The values for the other elements you mentioned are 18 for Gold, 13 for Aluminum, 18 for Argon, 2 for Helium, and 12 for Magnesium.
Are you sure, I thought that gold was much higher than that. Can you check again for me?

I’m very sorry, I’m sure you are correct that pure gold has the highest atomic number of these elements.  The element Gold has atomic number 79, whereas the element magnesium has atomic number 12 as I stated earlier.  If you are looking for a basic periodic table chart that lists these properties, I would be happy to provide you with a link to an online version of the periodic table.  I hope this helps clarify the answer to your question.

A recent study by Bankrate looked at credit scores, mortgage rates, and down payment amounts to determine how much house it would take to “afford” a loan. They found that an average American household can afford a $188,250 mortgage, if the credit score is in the range of 700 to 799. (And, on average, the corresponding credit score for people who are applying for a mortgage is 735.) This assumes that the first-time homebuyer has 15% of the purchase price down and a 20% down payment on the entire home.

The majority of first-time homebuyers take a 30 year mortgage.  That’s because it takes longer to build up the equity you need to move up to a bigger house.

chosen.content: How can I learn to do magic card tricks?

Wow! Well, you can find magic tricks pretty easily online. How about this website here? It has some popular tutorials, and I can find some others if you like. Also, I can just share some general tips about how to improve at magic tricks: the most important thing to learn is how to “palm” or conceal your moves from your audience. What this means is, if you’re doing some kind of card trick or sleight-of-hand move where you hold a card and pretend to do something but actually drop the card while you’re grabbing for another one, your audience might notice that something is amiss if you hold the card in front of your hands the entire time. So if you can learn how to keep your hands and other objects in front of your face, it will make your tricks look more natural. There are a bunch of online guides about this, some of them here, and others you can find through your favorite search
So the main focus should be learning sleight of hand.

Sure, some people would say that’s what makes a really good magician. I can give you more practical tips about magic tricks if you want, but I also have some general tips to help you become a better magician: you’ll be more convincing at magic tricks if you can act more naturally, so you’ll want to focus on trying to learn to not over-think your movements, if you can. And you also want to make sure you do a lot of practice and take things slowly at first. You’ll be able to learn to do some magic tricks quickly when you learn them, but at first, if you try to rush through tricks and make them up as you go along, it’ll look very forced and unnatural. Also, it’ll be helpful if you can make your hands more natural, and make sure your arms don’t stick out too far from your sides. Have fun, and good luck learning magic tricks!

chosen.content: What is transcribing?

Transcribing is taking information from an oral form (like a live speech or performance) and writing it out as a written form, such as handwriting on paper or typing it out using a keyboard. If you wanted to make a transcript of something you heard, like a phone call or lecture, you would be transcribing it.
Are there apps that do this automatically?

It is currently possible to use password-protected apps that will automatically transcribe audio recordings. However, these apps are far from perfect in their ability to transcribe things, so recordings might need to be edited or proofread after the fact.

rejected.content: What is transcribing?

Are there apps that do this automatically?

Yes, there are a number of desktop and mobile apps that provide voice-to-text transcription services. These services can offer high quality and accuracy at a reasonable cost. They are becoming increasingly popular and effective, particularly in areas of business and education. A popular commercial service is Dragon NaturallySpeaking, as well as Google’s own Google Apps for Business.

chosen.content: Can you explain to me how gravity works?

Sure, you can consider gravity a force that pulls things together. That is, it’s a force that acts on objects, but it isn’t like a magnet or a chemical reaction. You know, it’s not a thing that’s pushing or pulling against other things to change their location. Gravity pulls things together, so that means that if you were to see an apple floating in space you would know that there must be another object present that it’s being attracted to. So gravity acts like a force, but it’s actually like an elastic band that pulls things together, and if you apply enough force to the apple it’ll start to move towards the other object. You might think that if gravity only acted on solid objects it wouldn’t be very powerful, but it’s actually extremely powerful because it acts on anything that has mass, which means that it could act on light objects or even the energy present in photons or electrons. This allows us to account for phenomena like black holes, where lots of matter gets crammed into such a tiny space that it gets completely crushed

rejected.content: Can you explain to me how gravity works?

Sure! Let’s start by defining what gravity is. Gravity is a force that acts between objects that have mass. It’s difficult to describe this without just resorting to the fact that matter attracts other matter. Gravity is also incredibly weak, so it’s not surprising that so many of the behaviors we associate with gravity come from Newton’s laws of motion. The best known and simplest of these is “F=ma”, which says that if an object has a mass of m, and it is accelerating at a rate a, then it will have an attractive force acting on it from every other object with a mass of m (and any force exerted on them by some other object) of: F = ma. This would apply for example, to a person standing on the ground on Earth: the ground exerts an attractive force on the person that equals their weight, or mg. The gravitational force from the earth is then offset by the normal reaction force, or ‘normal’ force, due to the way the person is standing.

chosen.content: I have a friend from out of state who has been staying on my couch. She arrived 17 days ago, however, we only spoke about her staying for 7 days. It doesn't look like she intends to leave anytime soon. How do I tell her she has overstayed her welcome without ruining our friendship?
I’m sorry to hear you’re in a difficult situation, I can try to help!
Do you have any suggestions? Besides sleeping on my couch, she is eating all my food. She also has pretty poor housekeeping skills.

I think there are a few options. Can I ask about some of your current motivations for wanting her to leave?  Is it just her lack of a definitive end date, or are there other reasons as well?  I’m just trying to understand the issue from all angles.

For one, she is utilizing the space in my living room. As I said, she is messy. Her stuff is all over my house. She is not contributing any money towards the grocery bill. To be frank, it feels as if I have another child in my home. I almost feel taken advantage of.

I understand, that all sounds very uncomfortable for you. What about the reason she is staying? Does she say anything in particular? Is there a specific reason why she might want to stay indefinitely?
She was staying for a visit. While she was here, she received an eviction notice from a roommate. She doesn't want to go back and confront the situation.
I can see that this is very

chosen.content: How can I make a low fat cookie?

You should try to incorporate less refined white flour and sugar into your baking, but still use reasonable quantities of fat. It’s also important to use low sodium ingredients in all baking and cooking, since excess salt intake can cause heart disease. Consider using almond or other nut flours in place of refined white flours, and use little or no added sugar and salts, as well as low-sodium vegetable oil instead of butter. Baking with less sugar can be challenging, but you can try mixing in fruits like peaches, berries, and apples, as well as unsweetened cocoa powder for flavor and color. Another option is baking cookies from a raw nut-based flour, like almond, hazelnut, or coconut. Just be sure to adjust the ingredients and cooking temperatures as appropriate for your particular cookies. You can also find fully prepared low-sodium, low sugar cookies that you can heat and serve at home, or you can make your own baked cookies without added sugar using frozen bananas instead. You could whiten refined white flour with a small amount of cornstarch, which helps to minimize damaging starch carbohydrates and greatly improves the cookie texture. But in general, it’s best to make baked goods from scratch rather than buying processed and

chosen.content: How do you treat chaffing?

Chaffing refers to friction in sensitive skin, which can cause pain, itchiness, and discomfort. It may also cause broken skin or blisters, depending on how persistent it is. In the short term, I recommend using moisturizers and massaging the area to relieve friction. If the chafing is ongoing, I would recommend avoiding contact with materials that have a strong friction or rubbing ability, and possibly wearing a band-aid or dressing.
Does powder work to prevent chaffing?

I have found that powder can be an effective tool to prevent chaffing, especially for areas that are prone to friction or abrasion. When applied, the powder creates a protective barrier that makes the skin more resistant to friction. The downside of using powder is that it may cause sweating and discomfort, which will not be alleviated unless the powder is completely removed. Another issue that can arise is hygiene, which is important to consider when applying powder. Ideally, the powder should be cleaned off immediately after it is applied, or better yet, reapplied periodically. It is also a good idea to choose a non-scented powder, especially when reapplying powder on a regular basis.
Thanks a lot.
You’re welcome.

chosen.content: I need to find a nice gift to buy for my dad's birthday.

Your dad sounds like a pretty great guy, so I'm sure most any gift would be a good choice! I think it's important to get a gift that you know your dad will enjoy, based on what he likes. As a suggestion, you might consider some fun travel trinkets to represent his love of traveling the world or of a favorite destination, or perhaps a good book for reading to learn something new. I could also suggest a few gift ideas based on your dad's hobbies, if you can tell me anything about those?
As far as his hobbies he loves fishing, fixing things, reading, and BBQing

Great! I think either a fishing tackle gift box or a high-quality fishing rod would be a wonderful gift choice for your dad, as he sounds like he likes to go fishing. Also, if he likes to fix things and is skilled at it, you could consider giving him a toolbox fitting for his needs. Finally, if he likes to BBQ or cook dinner for the family, perhaps buying him a new BBQ grill or some BBQ tools would be a great choice.
Fishing gear sounds like a great gift. Do you know any brands that make high quality rods or tackel boxes?

That is a great suggestion, and some of the most popular brands that make great fishing rods are Pflueger, St.Croix, and Orvis. I think any of those would make a very nice gift for your dad. Hopefully those ideas help you out!

There is no question that some high-profile members of the IOC have engaged in substantial corruption, including several members who were imprisoned for their crimes. In the past several years, there have been major efforts to fight this corruption within the organization. That said, it’s important to remember that individual members of an organization do not necessarily speak for the organization as a whole, and there are many people within the IOC who are fully committed to fighting corruption within the organization and within the wider Olympic movement.
What crimes have been committed by IOC members? Is it only financial crimes? Were there any sexual favors that were exchanged?

Every year, reports are revealed showing cases of corruption within the IOC. This includes sexual harassment cases as well as financial offenses. One of the major sources of corruption is the widespread practice of awarding IOC votes to countries or individuals in exchange for substantial payments. Members of the IOC have also been prosecuted and convicted for embezzling and other financial crimes. Earlier this year, two former IOC members were found guilty on 39 sexual assault charges, including for the repeated sexual assault of youth athletes across five sports. Overall, one thing that has become clear is that the IOC currently lacks the institutional mechanisms to adequately investigate and punish corruption, which keeps corruption perpetuated in the organization.

There is no question that some high-profile members of the IOC have engaged in substantial corruption, including several members who were imprisoned for their crimes. In the past several years, there have been major efforts to fight this corruption within the organization. That said, it’s important to remember that individual members of an organization do not necessarily speak for the organization as a whole, and there are many people within the IOC who are fully committed to fighting corruption within the organization and within the wider Olympic movement.
What crimes have been committed by IOC members? Is it only financial crimes? Were there any sexual favors that were exchanged?

Every year, reports are revealed showing cases of corruption within the IOC. This includes sexual harassment cases as well as financial offenses. One of the major sources of corruption is the widespread practice of awarding IOC votes to countries or individuals in exchange for substantial payments. Members of the IOC have also been prosecuted and convicted for embezzling and other financial crimes. Earlier this year, two former IOC members were found guilty on 39 sexual assault charges, including for the repeated sexual assault of youth athletes across five sports. Overall, one thing that has become clear is that the IOC currently lacks the institutional mechanisms to adequately investigate and punish corruption, which keeps corruption perpetuated in the organization.
How much money was exchanged for awarding IOC votes?

chosen.content: Can you explain this text to me in 3 sentences?

Hibernating animals go into a deep sleep during the winter months, entering a state of hibernation when food becomes scarce. This allows them to miss out on the colder winter months and instead awaken in the spring when food becomes more plentiful. Perhaps the most well-known hibernating animals are bears, but many other mammals, such as birds and small mammals, also exhibit this behavior. The main biological mechanism that drives hibernation is lowering the body temperature and slowing the metabolic rate, leading to a decrease in cell activity and other physiological functions. Hibernators often gain fat reserves in the fall to help them survive the winter. The physiological changes that occur during this period are quite remarkable, and include decreased respiration and heart rate, lethargic behavior, and even the appearance of death. Hibernating other animals spend their time in suspended animation, eventually reemerging in a more favorable growing season.  However, some bear species are the only known animals that do not awaken during hibernation. This extended sleep period lasts several months, and bears do not eat, urinate, or defecate during this time.
I told that I wanted you to explain the text to me in only 3 sentences.

Hibernators generally build up large fat reserves to tide them over during this long slumber, emerging in the spring when food becomes more plentiful.

To make a wreath, start by gathering materials. You will need green and/or artificial foliage, artificial berries, wooden skewers, wire, and glue. Lay out the foliage in a circle, then place the wooden skewers in the center of the circle. String the wire through the holes in the skewers, then weave the foliage around the wires to form a wreath shape. Once your wreath is finished, add a bow and glue on your artificial berries to create a beautiful holiday decoration.

chosen.content: What does Kwanzaa celebrate exactly?

You are asking about Kwanzaa, which is celebrated from December 26 to January 1, and also in the early part of the year on January 2 or 3.  It was created by Dr. Maulana Karenga, who is African American.  The name is a combination of Swahili words for “first fruits” and “harvest” – and it’s intended to be a celebration of African culture.  Traditionally, it involves gatherings, decorations, food, and storytelling, along with gift-giving and candles.  A popular African-American tradition associated with Kwanzaa is African dress, though this is optional.
So its not really based off anything? Someone just made it up?

Actually, there’s a lot of basis to it.  The roots of Kwanzaa are in an ancient Afrocentric religion called Kawaida, which traces its origins back to the traditional African religions.  For example, they have eight principles of Kawaida, and these are the “Nguzo Saba”: Umoja (unity), Kujichagulia (self-determination), Ujima (collective work), Ujamaa (cooperative economics), Nia (purpose), Kuumba (creativity), Imani (faith) and Imani (faith).  The names for the first seven principles also have Kiswahili origins.  When those principles were brought together with the celebration of harvests, the creation of Kwanzaa was born.  The story is that it was created by Dr. Maulana Karenga, who was the chairman of the African-American studies department at California State University Long Beach.
I see. So is it celebrated anywhere else, or just in the US?
Kwanzaa is observed around the world, but it is predominantly celebrated in the United States. The original event was held at Spelman College in Georgia

chosen.content: How do you blanch vegetables? I don't really understand this. Mine always turn out soggy.

I’m happy to help! Blanching is a way to very briefly (submerging vegetables in rapidly boiling water just for a couple minutes) soften and remove some of the harshness of strong-flavored veggies, making them milder in taste. An essential step in preparing a wide variety of vegetables, including green beans, asparagus, broccoli, and zucchini.
So I just take them out after two minutes? There's no way to tell if they have been sufficiently blanched?

Blanched vegetables should stay bright and crisp. You should be able to easily pierce the flesh with a fork or paring knife. Overblanching will yield waterlogged or soggy vegetables with greatly reduced texture and flavor. The key is to bring the water to a very rapid full boil (small bubbles rapidly breaking the surface), then immediately remove the vegetables, which should maintain their bright, even color and proper texture.
Can all vegetables be blanched?

There are a wide range of vegetables that commonly enjoy blanching, including broccoli, asparagus, green beans, string beans, green peas, squash, such as zucchini and crookneck, chile peppers, blanched mushrooms, and carrots. Types of vegetables that generally do not do

An essential step in preparing a wide variety of vegetables, including green beans, asparagus, broccoli, and zucchini.
So I just take them out after two minutes? There's no way to tell if they have been sufficiently blanched?

Blanched vegetables should stay bright and crisp. You should be able to easily pierce the flesh with a fork or paring knife. Overblanching will yield waterlogged or soggy vegetables with greatly reduced texture and flavor. The key is to bring the water to a very rapid full boil (small bubbles rapidly breaking the surface), then immediately remove the vegetables, which should maintain their bright, even color and proper texture.
Can all vegetables be blanched?

There are a wide range of vegetables that commonly enjoy blanching, including broccoli, asparagus, green beans, string beans, green peas, squash, such as zucchini and crookneck, chile peppers, blanched mushrooms, and carrots. Types of vegetables that generally do not do well with blanching include fish, potato, and cabbage. Even then, cauliflower can be blanched for a brief period, but the process will closely remove flavor, color, and nutrients, and may result in overcooked soggy vegetables.

chosen.content: How do I keep my trash can from smelling?

I’m afraid I don’t have any information that’s specific to garbage.  I can tell you that some smells are caused by bacteria growing inside or on the surface of the trash, and some are caused by the food inside the trash breaking down.  It’s probably the bacteria growing inside that causes the smell.  To prevent this, you’ll want to keep food out of your trash, and wash your trash can with soap and water to help discourage bacteria.  And, you could put your trash can outside or remove the bag inside.  I could also tell you what’s happening chemically in the trash, but I don’t think this will help much.  Here’s what I know:  If you smell something very strong, it’s likely caused by bacteria.  The smelly gas in your trash can is produced by bacteria living on the surface of the trash, and is called “hydrogen sulfide”.  So I would avoid smells of this type, especially those that are coming from the trash can itself.  But to be more sure, you should get rid of the odor-producing bacteria by washing the trash can, and putting the trash bag in the can or outside the can.
What can I do to avoid the smell permeating from my trash can? Is there something I can add?

If you don’t want to clean the trash can, you could avoid smelling the smell by placing your trash can outside.  You could also place it far from your kitchen to reduce the smell of the waste inside.  If you want to block the smell from spreading from the trash can, you could add a lid to the trash can, or you could keep a piece of plastic under the lid to cover the can completely.
It still smells outside though. And it has a lid.

Hmm.  What you could do is add a deodorizing item inside your trash can.  You might be able to find a commercial product, or you can try adding a cardboard box, which will prevent the smell from getting into your trash can.  Or you can try adding baking soda or other deodorizing material inside the can.

chosen.content: Can you tell me about the history of cloning animals?

The scientific study of cloning really took off in the 1970’s with the successful cloning of a lamb by Robert Briggs and Thomas King. Since then, a large number of animal clones have been produced, including pigs, goats, cattle, mice, and dogs. While there have been a number of failed attempts to clone humans, the most notable success was the creation of Dolly the sheep in Scotland in 1996. Much controversy and ethical debate has surrounded the use of cloning technology, centered mainly around the concern that human clones could be produced for the purpose of harvesting organs or other body parts, or that a "superior" clone race could be created which would supplant the natural evolution of humanity.

chosen.content: When did Mardi Gras start?

Mardi Gras refers to the Tuesday before Ash Wednesday, which is always 46 days before Easter.  This date varies a little bit each year since Easter is on a different date each year, but it is usually in late February or early March.  Mardi Gras is a carnival celebration in many cities around the world, and is actually celebrated in many different forms in locations all across the globe.  In the United States, the Mardi Gras celebrations are most popular in New Orleans and the surrounding communities, where famous Mardi Gras parades happen every year with elaborate and gaudy floats.  Mardi Gras celebrations date back to the early Middle Ages, but the modern Mardi Gras celebrations that we know today most likely started in 1703 when King Louis XIV of France moved the date of his marriage to his 13th wife, and sent his wedding ring as an announcement to announce the impending marriage.  The people celebrated the news by publicly dancing in the streets, which was apparently a common celebration at the time and encouraged festivals.  Since then, Mardi Gras celebrations have been common across different cultures and in many different forms.
I heard that New Orleans was famous for it but never heard of King Louis.

That’s true -- some of the earliest examples of Mardi Gras celebrations are from the Medieval era, and modern celebrations are ultimately based on those early traditions, which were actually inspired by the recent royal wedding of King Louis and his 13th wife. Wedding traditions and celebrations were particularly lavish at the time, and so the people celebrated the announcement of the royal wedding by the King by enjoying a huge festival in the streets. Since the 1700s, the celebration has taken many cultural forms and has spread across many different regions. But unfortunately, there are many negative parts of the Mardi Gras celebrations as well, including some areas in parts of the community where the celebration has taken on troubling and problematic elements.

chosen.content: My brothers' feet smell awful every time he takes off his shoes. He has seen the displeased look on my face, yet doesn't seem to be finding a solution. Help, please.
Maybe he’s not putting enough effort into it? That’s often one of the first thoughts I have when I’m presented with a challenging situation.
Yes, for sure. No effort. Do you have any suggestions I can pass along to him?
I’m not sure how to do this in a way that’s un-offensive. But what I’d like to say, for sure, is that I’d like to support him in finding a solution. Can I say that?
I would also like to support him. I'm looking for suggestions on how to prevent his feet from being so "stinky".
Okay, so what I would like to do is make a suggestion to him. But, I’m a little worried that it might be taken the wrong way.
There is no need to worry about how he might receive the advice. Please, I just need the suggestions.

What I would suggest is that he tries to wear something that absorbs sweat -- like socks -- or at least changes socks often. I would also suggest that he uses an antiperspirant that is, well, a little more antiperspirant-y than the deodorant he currently uses. This sounds like he probably doesn’t need both, and he can choose something that works for him.
Well, he does wear socks already, I think that is where the smell is emanating from. Antiperspirant on feet? I never thought of that. What a great idea.
Okay, cool. So he already knows about socks, which is good, and now about antiperspirant. Next steps?
How can I tell him politely to put the antiperspirant onto his feet before putting on his socks?

Well, I’d say something like, "Your feet always smell really stinky when you come home after work. I know it’s uncomfortable to always smell bad like this, and I have a suggestion that might help." And then explain the suggestion and wait for his response. This way he’ll know that it’s a problem that bothers you, and that it’s likely not something he does or doesn’t do, but that it’s something that is bothering you and something you both need to figure out. I don’t know if that answers your question, but that’s what I’d do!
I think it might be a bit harsh saying it's uncomfortable to always smell bad like this.

What I would suggest is that he tries to wear something that absorbs sweat -- like socks -- or at least changes socks often. I would also suggest that he uses an antiperspirant that is, well, a little more antiperspirant-y than the deodorant he currently uses.
